name: the one where Ricardo filters the owners by first and last name
scenarioId: classpath:features/owners/filter_owners:the one where Ricardo filters the owners by first and last name
methodName: the one where Ricardo filters the owners by first and last name

testSteps.description:
Given Ricardo has registered the following owners in the system
| firstName | lastName | address | city | phone |
| Jost | Vander | zuid-hollandstraat 130-2 | Amsterdam | 0629423456 |
| Paola | Larrahondo | carrera 15F #30-15 sur | Bogota | 3158230923 |
| John | Doe | 123 Main St | Miami | 3051234567 |
| Jane | Doe | 128 Main St | Miami | 3051234267 |
| Arthur | Dent | 42 Main St | London | 0207946060 |
And he wants to filter the data of the owners displayed in the Owners page

children.description: Ricardo navigates to the all owners page
And he wants to filter the data of the owners displayed in the Owners page
Ricardo opens the browser at http://localhost:32770

exception.message:
Expected: an element that is currently visible
     but: no matching element found by [the element containing text 'Welcome to Petclinic' located with: xpath:.//*[contains(normalize-space(text()),'Welcome to Petclinic')]] was not visible

children.description: Ricardo clicks on the Owners menu
When he filters using the following information "John Doe"
Then he should see no owners

userStory.storyName: The Pet Clinic should allow to filter the owners in the system
userStory.displayName: The Pet Clinic should allow to filter the owners in the system
userStory.narrative:
As a VetClinic Manager
  I would like to be able to filter the owners in the system
  In order to find the owners and their pets easily

title: the one where Ricardo filters the owners by first and last name

testFailureCause.message:
The following 2 assertions failed:
1) Expected: an element that is currently visible
     but: no matching element found by [the element containing text 'Welcome to Petclinic' located with: xpath:.//*[contains(normalize-space(text()),'Welcome to Petclinic')]] was not visible
2) Expected: is not an empty collection
     but: was <[]>
